subprocess_flow.description: Gather relevant performance data from various sources, including project reports, performance metrics, and 360-degree feedback. Ensure data is comprehensive and covers the review period. Data should be stored securely and accessed according to data privacy policies.

Utilize GenAI to analyze the consolidated performance data and identify key performance insights, strengths, and areas for improvement. The GenAI should be configured to avoid bias and ensure fairness in its analysis. The analysis should be documented and auditable.

Managers review the initial performance insights generated by GenAI, adding their own observations and context based on their direct interactions with the employee. Managers should validate the accuracy of the AI-generated insights and provide additional qualitative feedback.

Provide employees with the opportunity to conduct a self-assessment, reflecting on their performance, achievements, and challenges during the review period. This self-assessment provides valuable context and perspective for the performance review process.

Conduct a formal performance review meeting between the manager and employee to discuss performance insights, feedback, and development goals. The meeting should be a constructive dialogue, focusing on both strengths and areas for improvement. Document key discussion points and agreed-upon actions.

Finalize the performance review document, incorporating feedback from the meeting and agreed-upon development goals. Ensure the document is accurate, fair, and compliant with company policies and legal regulations. Store the document securely in the HRIS system.
success_criteria: Complete and accurate performance review document

subprocess_flow.description: Provide ongoing support and resources to employees to help them achieve their development goals. Regularly check in with employees to monitor progress and provide additional guidance as needed. Track the effectiveness of development plans and make adjustments as necessary.
